title: Convergence of Art and Play: Innovations in Social Studies Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational theories and knowledge of social studies curriculum content
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers acquire methods to design social studies lessons by integrating arts-based and play-centered learning.

learning_goals: Designing a social studies lesson plan utilizing three art-based learning strategies
Developing a collaborative project applying five play-centered learning principles
Learners identify ≥3 teaching methods reflecting art-play interaction, submit an integrated plan (5–7 pages), and achieve "Excellent" ratings in ≥4 of 5 rubric items.

Learners create ≥3 creative instructional materials (worksheets, card games, role-play scenarios) in public education settings with limited technology (1 PC, basic software, A4 paper). They achieve ≥80% suitability scores through peer review and field applicability testing.
Improving lesson design through peer feedback and self-assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
